statements.name: PROC FITTEDQNET
statements.description: Trains a model by using the fitted Q-network (FQN) algorithm.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies the data table for the FQN training algorithm to be applied to.

arguments.name: DETERMINISTIC
arguments.description: tells the NVIDIA CUDA Deep Neural Network library (CuDNN) that you want only the deterministic implementations.

arguments.name: INMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies the table that contains the model structure and trained weights.

arguments.name: LOGFREQ=
arguments.description: specifies how frequently to display messages in the log. The frequency is based on the number of iterations.

arguments.name: SEED=
arguments.description: specifies the seed to use for the random number generator for training.

arguments.name: USEGPU
arguments.description: specifies that a GPU device is to be used. You can specify the following suboption:

arguments.name: USEGPU
arguments.description: specifies the ID number of the GPU device to be used.

statements.name: ACTION
statements.description: The ACTION statement specifies the action variable in the data table to use for training and scoring an FQN model.

arguments.name: ACTION
arguments.description: specifies the action variable in the data table.

statements.name: DONE
statements.description: The DONE statement specifies the done variable in the data table to use for training and scoring an FQN model.

arguments.name: DONE
arguments.description: specifies the done variable in the data table.

statements.name: OPTIMIZATION
statements.description: The OPTIMIZATION statement specifies the optimizer parameters to use in training an FQN model.

arguments.name: ADAM
arguments.description: specifies the optimization method to use in training the FQN model.

arguments.name: ADAM
arguments.description: specifies the exponential decay rate for the first-moment estimates for the Adam optimizer.

arguments.name: ADAM
arguments.description: specifies the exponential decay rate for the second-moment estimates for the Adam optimizer.

arguments.name: ADAM
arguments.description: specifies the value to add to the second moment of the gradient in the denominator to improve numerical stability.

arguments.name: ADAM
arguments.description: uses the AMSGrad variant of the Adam optimizer.

arguments.name: SGD
arguments.description: specifies the optimization method to use in training the FQN model.

arguments.name: SGD
arguments.description: specifies the momentum value for the SGD optimizer.

arguments.name: SGD
arguments.description: enables Nesterov momentum.

arguments.name: SGD
arguments.description: specifies the damping value for momentum.

arguments.name: LEARNINGRATE=
arguments.description: specifies the learning rate for the optimizer.

arguments.name: MINIBATCHSIZE=
arguments.description: specifies the number of observations in one minibatch. The number should be smaller than the total number of observations in the input data set.

arguments.name: REGL2=
arguments.description: specifies the L2 regularization parameter.

statements.name: OUTPUT
statements.description: The OUTPUT statement creates an output data table that contains the results of PROC FITTEDQNET.

arguments.name: COPYVARS=
arguments.description: lists one or more variables from the input data table to be transferred to the output data table.

arguments.name: OUT=
arguments.description: creates an output data table that contains the results of PROC FITTEDQNET.

statements.name: QMODEL
statements.description: The QMODEL statement specifies the neural network parameters to use for estimating the Q-function.

arguments.name: LAYERDIM=
arguments.description: specifies the number of neurons in the neural network layer.

arguments.name: ACTIVATION=
arguments.description: specifies the activation function type for the neural network layer.

statements.name: REWARD
statements.description: The REWARD statement specifies the reward variable in the data table to use for training and scoring an FQN model.

arguments.name: REWARD
arguments.description: specifies the reward variable in the data table.

statements.name: SAVESTATE
statements.description: The SAVESTATE statement creates an analytic store for the model and saves it as a binary object in a data table. You can use the analytic store in the ASTORE procedure to score new data.

arguments.name: RSTORE=
arguments.description: creates an analytic store for the model and saves it as a binary object in a data table. You can use the analytic store in the ASTORE procedure to score new data.

statements.name: STATES
statements.description: The STATES statement specifies the current and future state variables in the data table to use for training and scoring an FQN model.

arguments.name: CURRENTSTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the variable that indicates the current state for training and scoring.

arguments.name: NEXTSTATE=
arguments.description: specifies the variable that indicates the next state for training and scoring.

arguments.name: NOMNOMINAL
arguments.description: specifies whether the state is nominal.

statements.name: TRAIN
statements.description: The TRAIN statement specifies the training parameters to use for training an FQN model.

arguments.name: OUTMODEL=
arguments.description: specifies a table to be used to save the model structure and weights.

arguments.name: CHECKPOINTFREQ=
arguments.description: specifies how often to save training parameters.

arguments.name: GAMMA=
arguments.description: specifies the discount factor to be used to compute long-term value.

arguments.name: INCHECKPOINT=
arguments.description: specifies the checkpoint table to be loaded to restore your model.

arguments.name: MAXGRADIENTNORM=
arguments.description: specifies the maximum allowed value for the gradient magnitude.

arguments.name: NUMEPOCHS=
arguments.description: specifies the number of epochs to use in training the model.

arguments.name: OUTCHECKPOINT=
arguments.description: specifies the table in which to save the current model as a checkpoint.

arguments.name: TARGETUPDATEINTERVAL=
arguments.description: specifies how often to reset the target Q model parameters to the current Q model parameters.
